Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk device-mapper-multipath
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: device-mapper-multipath bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The device-mapper-multipath packages provide tools that use the device-mapper multipath kernel module to manage multipath devices. Bugs: Previously, multipath prioritizer functions had default timeouts that could last up to 5 minutes. Consequently, if a multipath device failed after the checker function claimed it was usable, the prioritizer became unresponsive. Now, the timeouts of prioritizer functions can be set with the checker_timeout option, thus fixing this bug. (BZ#1069811) When multipath had multiple paths per pathgroup, and the path selector was set to round-robin, these paths could be ordered in a way that caused the I/Os to be suboptimally distributed between controllers. Consequently, multipath load balancing was not causing sufficient performance boost. This update enhances the multipath ordering, and multipath load balancing now performances optimally. (BZ#1080038) When a multipath device was reloaded outside of the multipathd daemon and if existing paths were removed from the device, mutipathd still treated them as belonging to the multipath device. Consequently, multipathd could try to access a non-existent path_group and terminate unexpectedly. Now, multipathd correctly disassociates removed paths, thus fixing the bug. (BZ#1080055) Previously, the user_friendly_names binding file in initramfs under certain circumstances did not match the file in the normal system. A multipath device could thus be assigned a user_friendly_name that conflicted with the name already assigned by the normal system. Consequently, multipath in some cases attempted to update an incorrect device, causing data corruption. With this update, multipath checks whether device's paths user_friendly_name is already in use, and assigns a new name if it is. (BZ#1086825) Previously, when multipath performed a rename, it did not reload the device table as well. Consequently, if the user changed the device configuration, only the name was changed on the first reload and the rest of the changes appeared only after a second reload. With this update, multipath performs both the rename and the table reload, thus fixing the bug. (BZ#1104605) If the multipathd daemon failed to add a path to the multipath device table, it orphaned the path incorrectly, which caused multipath to treat the path as if it belonged to a multipath device. Consequently, multipathd in some cases repeatedly attempted to switch to a non-existent pathgroup. To fix this bug, multipathd now oprhans paths correctly, thus fixing the bug. (BZ#1110007) When the "parted" utility created partitions on an existing multipath device, it triggered race conditions with the kpartx utility to create the partitions, which could cause device- or resource-busy errors. With this update, kpartx only creates partition devices when the multipath device is activated, and it no longer automatically creates partitions when "parted" is run on existing multipath devices. (BZ#1148979) Enhancements: A new multipath.conf option, deferre_remove, has been added. If set to "yes", the multipathd daemon performs a deferred remove instead of a regular remove when the last path device has been deleted. It defaults to "no". (BZ#631009) A number of wildcard expressions have been added for the "multipathd show paths format" command, which facilitate the association of multipath paths with specific Fibre Channel hosts and targets as well as their ports, and thus allows users to manage their storage configuration more effectively. (BZ#979474) The device-mapper-multipath utility has been enhanced to verify the multipath.conf configuration file more reliably. Now, if multipath.conf contains any unparseable lines, device-mapper-multipath reports an error and ignores these lines. (BZ#1110013) Users of device-mapper-multipath are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
